energy_analysis module¶

class energy_analysis.EnergyAnalysis¶

Bases: object

Class that controls all class methods and finally delivers the requested information. It analyses energy data. .. attribute:: url

The url for the requested file

type

str

output_file¶

Desired name to the file

Type

str

df¶

The padas dataframe with the content of the file downloaded

Type

pandas.DataFrame

__init__: Init method

Class constructor to inizialize the attributes of the class.

download_file: Download method

Download a file base on the url strored in the object of the class, and reurns a pandas dataframe with the data

Emissions_Consumption(y)¶

Plots a scatter Plot comparing the Total Emissions of each country and its Total Energy Consumption of a given year. The population of each country can also be compared by the size of the data points.

year: int Year that we want to analyse countries’ Total Emissons and Total Energy Consumption

Raises

  • ValueError –

  • If the input given is not an 'int' –

Returns

  • Scatter plot

  • How to use it

  • object.Emissions_Consumption(2010)

  • Quick Notes about the Scales of X & Y Axis

  • —————-

  • X Axis

  • Eg (0.2 * 1e11 = 20 000 000 000 Tonnes of CO2 emissions)

  • Y Axis

  • Eg (100 000 = 100 000 of Energy Consumed Tera-Watts)

consumption_country(countries: str)¶

Select the Countries, sum up the total per year and plot it :param countries: A list with all countries to be analyzed :type countries: list

Returns

Return type

Plot with consumption and countries

Example

object.consumption_country([“Switzerland”, “Portugal”, “Chile”])

consumption_emission_country(countries: str)¶

Select the Countries, sum up the total consumption and emission per year and plot it on two different axes :param countries: A list with all countries to be analyzed :type countries: list

Returns

Return type

Plot with consumption, emmision and countries

Example

object.consumption_country([“Germany”, “Russia”, “China”])

download_file()¶

Downloads a file from the object.url address into your hard drive and read the dataset into the df attribute which it is a pandas dataframe. :param None:

Returns

dataset

Return type

pandas dataframe

Example

object.download_file()

Returns

object.enrich_with_emission()

forecast(n_periods: int, contry_code: str)¶

This method uses an ARIMA family algorithm to make and plot predictions about the total emission and total consumption values of a given country. :param n_periods: :type n_periods: Number of prediction periods, :param contry_code: :type contry_code: Country identifier

Returns

Return type

None

Example

object.forecas(5,”PRT”)

gapminder(y: int)¶

Plots a scatter Plot comparing the Gdp of each country and its Total Energy Consumption of a given year. The population of each country can also be compared by the size of the data points. Parameter —————- year: int Year that we want to analyse countries’ GDP and Total Energy Consumption :raises ValueError: :raises If the input given is not an ‘int’:

Returns

  • Scatter plot

  • Example

  • —————-

  • object.gapminder(2010)

gdp_country(countries: str)¶

Returns

Return type

relevant_and_total_consumption()¶

Removes the irrelevant and duplicated consumption data, and computes the total consumption. :param None:

Returns

None

show_consumption(country: str, normalize: bool)¶

Plots the normalized or not normalized consumptions of the past years of a given country. Parameter —————- country: str Name of the country that we want to analyze the consumption. normalize: bool Option if we want or not to normalize the consuption data. :raises ValueError: :raises If the country is not present on teh dataset:

Returns

Return type

None
